extension.description: Slideshow. Include with {besps}foldername{/besps}. Start automatically or by link/button.

field.name: im_width
field.label: Slideshow width
field.description: Width of the slideshow in pixels.

field.name: im_height
field.label: Slideshow height
field.description: Height of the slideshow in pixels.

field.name: im_align
field.label: Align the slideshow
field.description: This setting tells the plugin how to align the slideshow in relation to the available space.

field.name: sl_bgcol
field.label: Backgroundcolor (hex.)
field.description: The background color of the DIV-container holding the images (without leading #).

field.name: bs_sort
field.label: Sort order
field.description: The sort order your images get displayed.

field.name: sl_sdur
field.label: Time to show (sec.)
field.description: Time to show a picture in seconds.

field.name: sl_fdur
field.label: Duration of fading (sec.)
field.description: Duration of fading in seconds.

field.name: sl_steps
field.label: Fading steps
field.description: Steps to fade out a picture (1-100).

field.name: autostart
field.label: Start at pageload?
field.description: If set to yes, the slideshow starts automatically at pageload. If set to no, one has to use the following controls.

field.name: ctrl_show
field.label: Show controls?
field.description: If set to yes, the text or image you enter will be displayed below the slideshow. To use images upload them to 'images/stories/besps_buttons' and insert the filenames e.g. 'start.png'. The plugin detects '.jpg', '.gif' and '.png'.

field.name: ctrl_sort
field.label: Sort
field.description: The sort order and alignment of the control elements. '-' marks the split between left and right. if it is not present, controls are shown right. '1' marks the counter.

field.name: ctrl_start
field.label: Start (2)
field.description: Text/image for the link to start the slideshow (leave empty for default button). This element is represented by the number 2 in sorting.

field.name: ctrl_stop
field.label: Stop (3)
field.description: Text/image for the link to stop the slideshow (leave empty for default button). This element is represented by the number 3 in sorting.

field.name: ctrl_back
field.label: Back (4)
field.description: Text/image for the link to the previous image (leave empty for default button). This element is represented by the number 4 in sorting.

field.name: ctrl_fwd
field.label: Forward (5)
field.description: Text/image for the link to the next image (leave empty for default button). This element is represented by the number 5 in sorting.

field.name: cap_show
field.label: Show captions?
field.description: If set to yes, found captions are shown, if set to no, they get hidden.

field.name: cap_pos
field.label: Position of captions?
field.description: Choose where to show the captions, inside the main image or below.

field.name: link_use
field.label: Use links?
field.description: Choose whether to use found links.

field.name: imagepath
field.label: Image root
field.description: The path to the root folder in which your folders with images are stored (by default /images/).This part of the path is added by the plugin automatically to the foldername/path you specify in the code in your article. Usually there is no need to change this.

field.name: buttonpath
field.label: Buttonfolder
field.description: If you have set custom buttons for controls, this is the folder the plugin looks for them (by default /images/besps_buttons/).

field.name: stylesheet
field.label: Stylesheet
field.description: Select the stylesheet to use. This param allows to use custom stylesheets uploaded to the folder /plugins/content/simplepictureslideshow/files/

field.name: javascript
field.label: JavaScript
field.description: Select the JavaScript to use. This param allows to use custom scripts uploaded to the folder /plugins/content/simplepictureslideshow/files/

field.name: preld
field.label: Preload
field.description: Number of pictures statically loaded (minimum: 3, default: all). Visit bretteleben.de for more information on how to use this feature.

field.name: setid
field.label: Foldername as ID?
field.description: If set to yes, the name of the given folder is also set as identity of the toplevel DIV, allowing the use of custom styles for each slideshow.
